intro: Trichonema quadrangulum, commonly known as the four-cornered grass, is a species of flowering plant in the Poaceae family. It is a small, herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, temperate environments. The plant is characterized by its narrow, four-sided stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. Its leaves are usually linear and have a distinctive, slightly rough texture. Trichonema quadrangulum is often found in meadows, wetlands, and along stream banks, where it plays a minor role in local ecosystems.
